Detailed Description

A four-dimensional Menger Sponge.
A Menger Sponge in three dimensions is a fractal produced by subdividing a cube and taking away parts of the cube which get subsequentally smaller.
A four-dimensional Menger Sponge is created analogously from a hypercube.
The fractal can be further controlled by the distance parameter:
  • distance = 0: Only the innermost cube is removed, resulting in a four-dimensional foam
  • distance = 1: the innermost and the next to innermost cubes are removed, resulting in a foam in three dimensions, but holes in the four-dimensional structure
  • distance = 2: the holes reach the surface of the cube, resulting in a sponge structure
  • distance = 3: only the corners of the hypercube remain, resulting in dust
